sourceMeaningMnemonic: What kind of <radical>tree</radical> is <radical>spicy</radical>? A <kanji>Japanese birch</kanji>, or <kanji>birch</kanji>, obviously. There's nothing spicier than a Japanese birch!
meaningInfo: Imagine licking the trunk of a Japanese birch tree and feeling the heat on your tongue.
readingMnemonic: You can only cut down a <kanji>Japanese birch</kanji> using <reading>a zoo saw</reading> (<ja>あずさ</ja>) because a regular saw can't handle how spicy these trees are.
readingInfo: Imagine using a zoo saw to cut down a Japanese birch tree. What's a zoo saw? It's a saw that's used in zoos, to build all the animal enclosures. And to cut down spicy trees.
